item.title: ID-29 West - Bannock Pass - Idaho State Line
item.description: Idaho State Line on ID-29 west at Bannock Pass - Elevation 7672 Feet. Bannock Pass is on the Continental Divide located on the Idaho-Montana border.

item.title: ID-29 - Pavement Ends
item.description: Pavement Ends on ID-29 east. ID-29 is one of two state highways in Idaho (the other is ID-64) that has segments that are not paved.

item.title: ID-29 East - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on ID-29 east. Distance to Clark Canyon Dam (I-15 Jct. in Montana) and Dillon (Montana).

item.title: ID-28 South at ID-29
item.description: ID-28 south at ID-29 east to Dillon (Montana). Continue south on ID-28 for Rexburg and Idaho Falls.

item.title: ID-28 South Approaching ID-29
item.description: ID-28 South approaching ID-29 in Leadore.

item.title: End ID-29 at ID-28
item.description: End of ID-29 at ID-28 Junction. Lemhi Range in background.

item.title: ID-28 North at ID-29
item.description: ID-28 North at ID-29 Junction to Dillon,MT in

item.title: ID-29 - Bannock Pass - ID/MT Border
item.description: Bannock Pass at end of ID-29 on ID-MT Border

item.title: ID-29 East
item.description: ID-29 Shield, Lemhi County. ID-29 is one of two gravel highways in Idaho (the other is ID-64).

item.title: ID-29 West - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance To Leadore and Salmon, ID-29 on Bannock Pass
